poem:
Title: "Verdict in a Time of Plague"

Mankind, in its hubris seeks control,
Of viruses, dividing like breaking bread.
Queensland's court, cloak of justice worn,
Throws edicts to the wind, unbowed.
Humanity's rights, as weighty as the world,
Sits in balance with the breath of life.
Ponder the cost, in ambulance and patrol,
In the wake of this unquiet strife.
